name: Text
description: Resource intended to be perceived visually and understood through the use of language in written or spoken form.

name: Cartographic
description: Resource that shows spatial information, including maps, atlases, globes, digital, and other cartographic resources.

name: Notated music
description: Graphic, non-realized representations of musical works intended to be perceived visually.

name: Audio
description: Resources expressed in an audible form, including music or other sounds.

name: Still Image
description: Resource expressed through line, shape, shading, etc., intended to be perceived visually as a still image or images in two dimensions.

name: Moving Image
description: Images intended to be perceived as moving, including motion pictures and video recordings.

name: Artifact
description: Resource in a form intended to be perceived visually in three dimensions. Includes man-made objects as well as naturally occurring objects such as specimens mounted for viewing.

name: Mixed Material
description: Resource comprised of multiple types which is not driven by software; for instance, a manuscript collection of text, photographs and sound recordings.

name: Digital
description: Resource that is intended for manipulation by a computer, accessed either directly or remotely

name: Multimedia
description: Electronic resource that is a computer program or which consists of multiple media types that are software driven.

name: Dataset
description: Data encoded in a defined structure, but not normally displayed in its raw form.

name: Manuscript
description: Resource that is written in handwriting or typescript. These are generally unique resources.

name: Collection
description: Aggregation of resources, generally gathered together artificially.

name: Unspecified
description: The type of resource is unknown or undetermined.

name: Tactile
description: Resource that is intended to be perceived by touch.
